description: This course introduces the study of patterns and relationships satisfied by natural numbers. Topics include divisibility, modular arithmetic, prime numbers, congruences, primitive roots, and quadratic residues. The course is offered in Budapest, Hungary, a world center for research mathematics. The course includes several hours of Hungarian language instruction and lectures by Hungarian mathematicians and scholars. Prerequisite: Mathematics 220 or permission of instructor. Offered most Interims.
name: Number Theory - Budapest
notes: You will find this course listed in Studio Abroad under its course title.
prerequisites: Mathematics 220 or permission of instructor. Offered most Interims.
